ado_kukic.title: Developer Evangelist
ado_kukic.bio: Ado is a developer evangelist at Auth0 and Google Developer Expert for Web Technologies. Mixing his passion of programming and education, he creates tutorials, talks, courses, and other educational content focusing on security, authentication, and much more. On the front-end, he prefers Angular, while on the backend he flip-flops between Node.js and Golang.
ado_kukic.shortBio: Ado is a developer evangelist at Auth0 and Google Developer Expert for Web Technologies. Mixing...
ado_kukic.name: Ado Kukic

alexandre_martins.bio: Alexandre is a Software Engineer with 15 years programming experience in delivering enterprise software. Skilled in implementing complex software programs in Java with knowledge in back-end and front-end. Recently making a move to the JS world and is currently working at SkipTheDishes with React/React Native. He has 6 years of experience as professor of subjects like OOP, data-structures, artificial intelligence and distributed systems. During his master degree, he worked as software reuse researcher with component based development, software product lines and index/search/retrieval of components for reuse.

chris_demars.title: Front-End Developer
chris_demars.bio: Chris DeMars is a front end developer first, UX architect always, from Detroit, Michigan. For his community contributions, he holds awards as a Microsoft MVP in developer technologies and Google Developer Expert in web technologies. He is also an organizer for Vuetroit and co-organizer for the Ann Arbor Accessibility Group. Chris loves coming up with solutions for enterprise applications, which include modular CSS architectures, performance, and advocating for web accessibility. When he is not working on making the web great and inclusive you can find him writing blog posts, recording episodes of his podcast, Tales From The Script, watching horror movies, or in the woods of northern Michigan.
chris_demars.shortBio: Chris DeMars is a front end developer first, UX architect always...
chris_demars.name: Chris Demars

cleo_espiritu.bio: Cleo holds an MSc in computing science from the University of Alberta and has experience working in various roles, such as user experience designer, software developer, business analyst, and system designer. Her passion for designing and developing software that improves end-users' lives led her to champion and educate on the use of App Maker, Apps Script and G-Suite for people to transform the way they work.

diana_carrier.shortBio: Diana is a Software Developer at Bold Commerce where she uses JavaScript and PHP to create eCommerce solutions. Her favourite tools for solving problems are pair programming, glitch hop, and a good, strong cup of tea. She also co-hosts a weekly knitting podcast and recently became one of those morning people that gets up at 6am even on weekends and hopes this is where she'll find the time to start streaming coding on Twitch.

leonardo_miranda.title: Lead Cloud DevOps Engineer
leonardo_miranda.bio:
I am a Lead/Architect Cloud Devops/Systems Engineer. Working with infrastructure and managing servers for over 16+ years. Passionate about Open Source, Linux and Computers. My expertise are based on four skill sets: Coding and Scripting, Process re-engineering, Systems and IT Operations and Collaboration with others (Teamwork). 

 Huge experience with: SaaS, IaaS and PaaS environments. Lover of artificial technology, deep learning, data scientist, cloud servers and technology evangelist. Inspire and Motivate, if you are motivating someone to become someone better, congratulations! If you're not, you're wasting your time!

matheu_plouffe.bio: Born and raised in Winnipeg, Matheu grew up during the golden age of 8-bit video games. After graduating from the University of Manitoba with a degree in Film Studies and Philosophy, Matheu had a moderately successful run as a independent filmmaker before he becoming a programmer. After a brief stint working for a couple financial institutions, Matheu somehow landed his dream job at Ubisoft. Now he gets to spend his days helping develop the world's best video games, and loving life!

matheus_schettino.bio: Matheus Schettino is passionate developer, musician and life enthusiast. He has been working with front end development since before jQuery and he's always looking forward to helping everyone to achieve the best experience when writing code.

moe_touban.title: Software Engineer
moe_touban.bio: Moe finds it particularly awkward to write about himself in the third person. But once he gets past the awkwardness, he points out that he's a Mobile Software Developer on the CourierCore team at SkipTheDishes. He's been doing Android for a good long time now and is really happy that with Kotlin he can worry less on shipping bugs to prod.

noble_ackerson.bio: Noble is a Google Developers Expert for product strategy and a seasoned technical product lead delivering vision camera, web and mobile technologies from abstract concepts to final products. He led the award-winning DC-based Augmented Reality for fitness startup, LynxFit as Product Owner and Co-founder.   Noble sits on the Alumni Leadership Board for the leading online education startup, Udacity. A member of the Alumni Board at his alma mater, Lynchburg College and acts as the Publicity Chair for Ubicomp and ISWC, two top-tier conferences for the internet of things and wearable technology. When Noble is not focused on product, he is mentoring underrepresented and aspiring developers, speaking at technology events, or spending time with his daughters.

rasit_eskicioglu.shortBio: Rasit Eskicioglu received his B.Sc. in Chemical Engineering from Istanbul Technical University (Turkey) and M.Sc. in Computer Engineering...
rasit_eskicioglu.name: Rasit Eskicioglu
rasit_eskicioglu.title: Assoc. Prof.
rasit_eskicioglu.bio: Rasit Eskicioglu received his B.Sc. in Chemical Engineering from Istanbul Technical University (Turkey) and M.Sc. in Computer Engineering from Middle East Technical University (Turkey), and Ph.D. from University of Alberta. He has been teaching, and doing research and development mainly in experimental systems area for more than 35 years. His research interests include operating systems, cluster and grid computing, high-speed network interconnects, and mobile networks. Most recently, he is looking at wireless sensor networks (WSN) and their applications to real world problems, particularly indoor localization, monitoring, and tracking and Internet of things. Dr. Eskicioglu is currently a faculty member in the Computer Science Department at the University of Manitoba, Canada. He is a member of ACM, IEEE and IEEE Computer Society.

ronnie_magatti.name: Ronnie Magatti
ronnie_magatti.bio: Ronnie is a full stack software developer with more than 7 years of experience in the field -- passionate about Kotlin, Flutter and building new things.  He has worked with Kotlin on Android for about a year and a half at a Brazilian fintech, where he fell in love with the language.  Today, Ronnie works at SkipTheDishes and is enjoying his new life in Canada.
